newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds closed with good gains on Thursday, lifted by rising Bund futures and encouraged by the dollar retreating a little in Europe, dealers said.
But the Dutch market was again squeezed in comparison to Germany, they said, as investors found reason to switch in the longer maturities.
"There were no big sellers, but Guilders were definitely under pressure," one broker said. "But that is often what happens when the market is rising."
Some players have been predicting the yield discount between Dutch and German bonds to move towards zero in the near term.

"I think that depends on the directionof the market," the broker said. "If we don't push higher and hang around here, or even move down again, we should see some good demand for Guilders around these levels."
The Dutch market's move up on Thursday was largely in the wake of the September Bund future moving up to test the 103.00 resistance level, a dealer said.
"It's going to be tricky to get through that," he said. "I'm expecting a few bounces, so the way up is not clear yet."
The long end of the Dutch curve was the big gainer on the day, with the 30-year bond rising a half-point.
"There's hope there we may get some of the benefit of investors moving out of long-dated high-yield debt," a dealer said.
